column1: One evening—not long before Christmas—as he had cut out the usual quantity
column2: he said to his wife before going to bed
column3: "What say you to stopping up this night
column4: to see who it is that helps us so kindly?" His wife was satisfied
column5: and fastened up a light; and then they hid themselves in the corner of the room
column6: where hung some clothes which concealed them. As soon as it was midnight in came two little manikins
column7: who squatted down on the board; and
column9: set to with their little fingers
column11: and hammering so swiftly and lightly
column12: that the shoemaker could not take his eyes off them for astonishment. They did not cease until all was brought to an end
column13: and the shoes stood ready on the table; and then they sprang quickly away.
